value:
"Hero on the Wind," am I? The fact
that I am named Ced, like one of the
12 crusaders, is mere coincidence.

I set out from Silesse to seek a cure
for my mother. Taking care of her
alone must have been hard on Fee.

No matter the era, no matter the
realm... Must the weak be ground
under the heel of the strong?

My sister and I cannot help but aid
those in need—it's in our blood. My
mother is the same.

Someday I will return to Silesse and
devote myself to the people. But first
I must hone my knowledge.

By chance...do you know anything
of my father? Please, if you do...
Tell me.

I have grasped the power of Ced, the
legendary crusader...
For the people's liberation!

If I am wounded, it matters not.
Moving forward is all that counts.

I see you expect much from me...
I will do my best for you.

My name is Ced. I will do what I can
to alleviate the suffering of others, in
my father and mother's places.

I feel that we have achieved a real
rapport, $Nu.$k$pI probably mentioned this before, but
my father chose his own path. In
doing so, he abandoned his family.$k$pI had hoped my mother could see him
one last time before she passed,
though she never spoke of it.$k$pI think I understand why, now. My
father had his own journey. He had
to come to grips with something.$k$pYou have the same air about you.
Perhaps that is why I continue to fight
by your side. I hope that's all right.
はっ
それっ
くっ…
I was careless...!
Freedom comes!
We must believe!
I'm more than prepared.
I won't be defeated.
Was that the best I can do?
Sigh...
My name is Ced. I was defending Meath, and now, I'm here.
Oh! My apologies. Y-you surprised me. Can I be of service?
I came upon Meath while searching for my father. The people there needed my help, so I stayed.
Please, Lord Seliph... The people of this world have lost hope. Only you can save them.
My mother was deeply sincere and easily moved to tears.
Hero? Not I. I am as helpless as anyone.
Wherever you go, I shall follow!
At the ready!
Proceeding with caution.
I've been waiting.
